Use the _config.yml to specify the rules for generating pages like this one (including name and template).

In the template, you have access to all the fields defined in data for the record, like, for instance:

  • 8/10/2014
  • LinkedIn
  • Mountain View, CA
  • User Experience Researcher
  • LinkedIn Corp. is seeking a motivated, talented UED (User Experience Design) Researcher to join us. LinkedIn offers a research climate that encourages a wide range of methods and approaches to explore and understand our large suite of products. Our team is responsible for research that feeds the design, strategy and development of all products and services, covering both consumer (LinkedIn.com, mobile applications, subscriptions) and enterprise (talent, marketing and sales solutions). As a UED Researcher, you will drive the complete research process and collaborate closely with cross-functional counterparts in Product Management, Design, Web Development, Marketing, and Engineering to influence key strategy and execution decisions. Your research will be instrumental in defining the next-generation of LinkedIn products, as you spearhead a human-centered decision-making process, and develop the most useful and usable product experiences for a global audience.
Additionally, you also have access to page.name, which is the filename of the page, that is: index.html.
